summary: This document is an email chain between Department of Justice personnel discussing proposed redactions related to Jeffrey Epstein's medical records and statements following his death. The discussion focuses on whether to redact Epstein's statements about memory impairment from the incident and safety concerns in the SHU (Special Housing Unit).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The AUSA is requesting clarification on redaction policy for statements made by Jeffrey Epstein in medical records and emails, specifically regarding his memory of the incident and safety concerns.

events.title: Epstein's statements post-incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made statements about memory impairment from the incident (injury to his neck) possibly due to sleep apnea, and expressed a desire to remain 'down here where it is safe' in the SHU.

keyFacts: DOJ personnel are discussing redactions to protect details of the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein claimed his memory of the incident may be impaired due to sleep apnea.
Epstein expressed safety concerns in the SHU, asking to remain there because it was 'safe'.
The discussion indicates sensitivity around statements that might suggest Epstein was attacked.
The correspondence references medical records and emails containing these statements.
